item.title: Some people can't run my client, how can they get it to work?
item.dc:creator: @Rayne Rayne
item.description:
@Rayne wrote:

omg thats my tut lol…

Re: How to Fix 'Java' is not a internal or external command error.

Well you add it under “User Variables” and you left out the fact that you need to add a “PATH.”

Not leeched excerpt from my old tut.

First in the user variables create a new user variable and name it CLASSPATH. For the variable value add this -
Code

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%

Next create another user variable and name it PATH. For the variable value add this -
Code

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin

By doing this you are letting your compiler know where to search for the java.

Note. Your just showing people what to put where, your not explaining the purpose of it.

but yeah thats right, they need to update their java then.

Read full topic
item.source: Some people can't run my client, how can they get it to work?

item.title: Some people can't run my client, how can they get it to work?
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Schmoopy Sir Schmoopy
item.description:
@Sir_Schmoopy wrote:

I put a tut on that on my site and they did it.

First go to control panel>system>advanced options>enviormental variables. Here it will show user variables and system variables. Do not mess with the system variables. First in the user variables create a new user variable and name it CLASSPATH. For the variable value add this -

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%

Next create another user variable and name it PATH. For the variable value add this

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin

By doing this you are letting your compiler know where to search for the java.

Is that wrong?

Read full topic

soultak3r:

you probably messed up something in ur egui, did you try to recolor or anything

Just no one else can get it to work.

item.title: Some people can't run my client, how can they get it to work?
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Schmoopy Sir Schmoopy
item.description:
@Sir_Schmoopy wrote:

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
‘But’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .
